screen_desc: The screenshot displays a theme customization screen for a keyboard. The keyboard has a green theme with white text and includes options for input such as letters, numbers, and symbols. Below the keyboard, there's a toggle switch labeled "Key borders" and an "APPLY" button to save the changes. The user can enable or disable key borders and apply the selected theme.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.
click on the "System" option located at the middle-lower part of the screen.
click on the "Languages & input" located at the upper left.
click on the "Virtual keyboard" settings located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.
click on the "Gboard Multilingual typing" option located at the upper left side of the screen.
click on the "Theme" located at upper middle and left.
click on the theme option located at right and lower middle.
action_plan: Toggle the 'Key borders' option if desired, and then press the 'APPLY' button to confirm and save the changes.

action_with_memory.Next Single Step Action: Toggle the 'Key borders' option if desired, and then press the 'APPLY' button to confirm and save the changes.
